column5: Hey Everyone, I'm a new member!  Right now I'm living in Windsor for the next couple of months.  I've heard there is a really good run of Walleye in the spring in the Detroit river.  Since I don't have a boat does any one know of any good shore casting spots that I might be able to get into them?  or perhaps get some roaming Pike??  Any feedback would be greatly appreciated!
Windsor? i thought everyone got laid off and moved...
....Welcome a "board". Can't help you with the fishing down that way but I'm certain someone will.

You need to talk to Mr. Bob Devine about this topic!  Every year the Extreme Team X heads down that way to fish the river and from what I've been told they have a blast on the river.  He does Charters down that way! http://www.chartertalk.com/    would be his site to check on.   Extreme Army Team Robert"Spike" Broadbridge

Welcome FWF to the board.  If you do a site search using the words 'Detroit River' you'll find a bunch of posts on the river.  Check out the one by Mooseroo from last October about "Heading To Windsor..."  You'll find some good bits of info that might be useful to ya.

try next to lilly kazillys resyuarant in spring. also lakeview park marina before they open the west wall is best. also you can try at ambassador park. the walleyes will be soon. the ice is slowly rotting. with a year round season and a 6 fish limit, im sure you will enjoy a few fillets if you desire. try wallys baits at sandwhich and mill street. they have great info.
Thanks for the quick responses everyone.  I'll have to check up on all those sites.  Like someone said I'm still waiting for the ice to totally clear but it shouldn't be too much longer!
See you there real soon-can't wait! Mark
And a Welcome to you too
Can't help you with the fishing there but welcome to the board anyway!
